title: How Long Does Spain's Camino de Santiago Take?
text:
How Long Does the Camino de Santiago Take? How many days or weeks should you set aside for the St James' Way? bernavazqueze @7870793@N03 flickr.com Creative Commons License By Damian Corrigan Updated November 30, 2016 . 
Considering the number of Camino de Santiago routes , and the fact that many people don't do an entire route, the question "How long does the Camino de Santiago take?" is like asking "How long is a piece of string?" 
However, if you plan on doing the whole of the most popular route , the Camino Frances , from St Jean Pied de Port in France to Santiago de Compostela, the walk should take you about 30 to 35 days . To achieve this time, you would need to walk between 23 and 27 kilometers per day (14-16 miles) . 
See also: Where Does the Camino de Santiago Begin? 
What if you don't feel you have the time to spend up to seven weeks on the road? There is no reason you have to start in St Jean Pied de Port. Read more about Where to Start the Camino de Santiago . What Do I Do If I Have Less Than a Month? 
If you don't plan on doing the whole of the Camino Frances, you have a few questions you need to ask yourself. 
continue reading below our video Tipping Etiquette Around the World How much time do I have to spare to do the Camino de Santiago? Can I come back in future and continue where I left off? Is it really important that I reach Santiago de Compostela this time ? Shorter Itineraries that End in Santiago 
If you decide that you have to finish the Camino this time, consider walking these shorter routes: Pamplona to Santiago de Compostela: about 28 days Logroño to Santiago de Compostela: about 25 days Burgos to Santiago de Compostela: about 20 days Leon to Santiago de Compostela: 12-14 days Ponferrada to Santiago de Compostela: eight or nine days Sarria to Santiago de Compostela: four to seven days. See also: Seven-Day Walking Tour from Sarria to Santiago de Compostela Other Itineraries: by Number of Weeks 
If you don't necessarily need to get to Santiago on this trip, consider one of these: Five Weeks St Jean Pied de Port/Roncesvalles to Santiago de Compostela Four Weeks Pamplona to Santiago de Compostela Logroño to Santiago de Compostela Three Weeks Burgos to Santiago de Compostela Two Weeks Leon to Santiago de Compostela Ponferrada to Santiago de Compostela One Week
